doc.after: Secret police not only have the traditional police authority to arrest and detain but in some cases they are given unsupervised control of the length of detention assigned to implement punishments independent of the public judiciary and allowed to administer those punishments without external review The tactics of investigation and intimidation used by secret police enable them to accrue so much power that they usually operate with little or no practical restraint
